text: Gerd Albrecht (19 July 1935 – 2 February 2014) was a German conductor. He was a first-prize winner at the International Besançon Competition for Young Conductors at age 22. He composed with many famous European orchestras such as Deutsche Oper Berlin, the Tonhalle-Orchester Zürich and the Hamburg State Opera. Albrecht was born in Essen. Albrecht died at the age of 78 on 2 February 2014 in Berlin, Germany. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2014 deaths Category:German conductors Category:Musicians from North Rhine-Westphalia Category:People from Essen
title: Gerd Albrecht
